name: Reverse multi-protocol implant
author: BishopFox
description: A reverse multi-protocol implant/listener generation stub. This module allows to specify different communication protocols, along with their hosts/domains, that the implant will use for C2 callback. These protocols are used in a certain order, only if the preceding protocol used resulted in an error

LimitResponseDomain.name: HTTP Domain
LimitResponseDomain.description: Limit HTTP responses to a specific domain

DomainsDNS.name: Domains (DNS)
DomainsDNS.description: DNS C2 domain connection strings for implant (Use FQDN) (Comma-separated list)

DomainsHTTP.name: Domains (HTTP)
DomainsHTTP.description: HTTP connection strings for the implant to callback (Use FQDN) (Comma-separated list)

DomainsMTLS.name: Domains (mTLS)
DomainsMTLS.description: MTLS domains/addresses for the implant to callback (Use FDQN) (Comma-separated list)

LetsEncrypt.name: LetsEncrypt
LetsEncrypt.description: Attempt to provision a Let's Encrypt certificate

Website.name: Website
Website.description: Website name (placed in front of listener, takes care of snoopers)

Key.name: Key
Key.description: PEM encoded private key file (HTTPS listener)

Format.name: Format
Format.description: File format extension of the implant

SkipSymbols.name: SkipSymbols
SkipSymbols.description: Set to to true to skip symbol obfuscation

DomainsDNSListener.name: DNS listener domains
DomainsDNSListener.description: Canary DNS domains for the listener, which can handle multiple implants (Comma-separated list)

Canaries.name: Canaries
Canaries.description: Canary DNS domains (make sure you have/will have a DNS listener running) (Comma-separated list)

LimitDomainJoined.name: LimitDomainJoined
LimitDomainJoined.description: Limit execution to domain joined machines
